snippet: An inspector general’s report described a failure to stop the singling out of conservative groups as Congressional aides tried to find out how far knowledge of the effort reached.
abstract: Inspector general's report blames ineffective Internal Revenue Service management for missteps involving the Tea Party and other conservative groups as Congressional aides seek to determine whether the Obama administration's knowledge of the effort extended beyond the IRS; if inquiry determines any link to the administration, it could change the political equation for the White House, which has stressed the IRS' independence even as Obama has castigated the agency over the allegations of political bias.
lead_paragraph: An inspector general’s report described a failure to stop the singling out of conservative groups as Congressional aides tried to find out how far knowledge of the effort reached.

headline.seo: Report on I.R.S. Audits Cites Ineffective Management
headline.main: Management Flaws at I.R.S. Cited in Tea Party Scrutiny
headline.print_headline: Mismanagement by I.R.S. Cited in Tea Party Scrutiny
